articles.description: His Leicester side had to ride their luck at times against West Ham, but victory for a smiling Ruud van Nistelrooy is already giving Foxes fans their "belief" back.
articles.title: Ruud van Nistelrooy: Smiling Dutchman brings belief back to Leicester after West Ham win

articles.description: Watch, listen and follow live updates as Republic of Ireland face Wales in the Euro 2025 qualifying play-off final second leg.
articles.title: Republic of Ireland vs Wales: Watch, listen and follow live updates from Euro 2025 play-off

articles.description: German Cup holders Bayer Leverkusen progress to the quarter-finals as they narrowly beat 10-man Bayern Munich.
articles.title: Bayern Munich 0-1 Bayer Leverkusen: Nathan Tella scores in German Cup

articles.description: Jean-Philippe Mateta scores a classy winner as Crystal Palace earn their first Premier League away win of the season by beating fellow strugglers Ipswich.
articles.title: Ipswich 0-1 Crystal Palace: Jean-Philippe Mateta scores classy winner

articles.description: Jaker Ali and Taijul Islam play key roles as Bangladesh secure a first Test win in the West Indies for 15 years to draw their two-match series.
articles.title: Bangladesh beat West Indies to draw Test series and end 15-year wait

articles.description: This Scotland squad often talk about what they deserve. But yet again they have not earned what they think they are due.
articles.title: Euro 2025 play-offs: Scotland's golden generation miss their golden hour

articles.description: Calls for Grace Clinton to break into England's starting XI for Euro 2025 will only increase after yet another impressive display in their victory over Switzerland.
articles.title: Grace Clinton: Is Manchester United midfielder pushing to start for England at Euro 2025?

articles.description: The FIA wants to limit the ways its leadership can be held to account for bad governance after allegations were made against its president.
articles.title: FIA seeks rule changes in wake of president allegations

articles.description: Tiger Woods has said he still has "fire to compete" despite not featuring in a golf tournament for five months following a sixth back surgery.
articles.title: Tiger Woods: American still has 'fire' to compete amid injury issues

articles.description: Raphinha inspires Barcelona to a huge victory over Mallorca as they end their three-game winless run.
articles.title: Mallorca 1-5 Barcelona: Raphinha scores twice to extend lead at top of La Liga
